image.altText: A yacht at sea.

props.synopsis: Comanche has crossed the finish line first, taking out line honours in the 80th Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race, after a speedy race down the River Derwent. Follow live.

title.children: Comanche speeds down river to take Sydney to Hobart line honours

image.altText: A menorah candle drawn in chalk on the bridge where the gunmen stood and fired multiple rounds into the crowd

props.synopsis: Sydneysiders can expect to see more police officers carrying long-armed guns in the weeks ahead, with the premier not ruling out sending troops to protect the Jewish community.

title.children: Sending army to protect Sydney's Jewish community 'not off the table'

image.altText: Tim Picton, Mark McGowan and Ellie Whiteaker stand with their arms around each other.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man has been granted bail after allegedly assaulting Tim Picton, a prominent Labor Party identity — an attack police prosecutors say may leave him permanently disabled, if he survives.

title.children: Man charged with Tim Picton assault granted bail

image.altText: White cruise ship on water with island in background.

props.synopsis: The Coral Adventurer has run aground off the coast of Papua New Guinea with more than 120 people aboard, two months after the death of a passenger allegedly left behind on a Great Barrier Reef island.

title.children: Australian cruise ship runs aground off PNG

image.altText: A man in a check shirt leans on a gate

props.synopsis: Police say they responded to reports of a domestic assault at a home in South Australia's south-east on Saturday.

title.children: SA independent MP Nick McBride charged with assault

image.altText: A candle placed in front of a vigil.

props.synopsis: In the weeks before Christmas, four boys under 16 left home to play a game of soccer. Their forced disappearance at the hands of Ecuador's military has been labelled a national "turning point".

title.children: Four boys left home to play soccer. Why they never returned has divided Ecuador

image.altText: a woman with hand on her face is drawn in three overlapping neon colours

props.synopsis: From the rise of misinformation and AI to escalating political tensions, vast economic disparity, and the erosion of social bonds, the vibe shift is now understood as a deep, unsettling change in our collective reality.

title.children: Forget brat summer, the vibe shift is here and it's terrifying

image.altText: Black and white paper receipts are arranged on a timber table.

props.synopsis: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

title.children: In Taiwan you can win lottery just by shopping

image.altText: The front of a sandstone building reads' The Donald Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts'

props.synopsis: Musician Chuck Redd cancelled his Christmas Eve show days after the White House announced the venue would be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.

title.children: Kennedy Center boss demands $1.5m damages after musician cancels show

image.altText: Peter Malley 1

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police say the death in custody of an Indigenous woman in Tennant Creek on Saturday was the result of a "medical episode", while admitting there was no nurse on duty at the time.

title.children: Police say Tennant Creek death in custody was result of 'medical episode'

image.altText: A cricket executive and a head curator stand in front of microphones and recorders, with the curator answering questions.

props.synopsis: MCC boss Stuart Fox staunchly defends chief curator Matt Page after a wild Boxing Day Test finishes within two days.

title.children: MCC boss defends curator Matt Page after two-day Ashes Test

image.altText: George Napper takes a selfie while wearing a black singlet in the car.

props.synopsis: A rising number of Australians are using steroids. But one expert says a lack of knowledge and widespread stigma make it tough to get clinical support.

title.children: Steroid use is 'exploding' in Australia — but quitting is a lonely road

image.altText: An image of a man standing on sand, facing the ocean, with his legs blurred.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged for allegedly displaying what police have called "hate symbol" tattoos at a beach in Newcastle.

title.children: Man charged for allegedly displaying hate symbol tattoos at NSW beach

image.altText: The backs of a man and woman who are sitting on a grassy spot overlooking a beach

props.synopsis: Despite wanting to learn how to swim, many from culturally and linguistically diverse communities — particularly adults — face three key barriers to participating.

title.children: Why getting more migrants to swim has benefits for all of Australian society

image.altText: Tasmania Police crime scene tape

props.synopsis: A woman has died and a man has been taken to hospital following a fatal glider crash at a private airfield in Tasmania.

title.children: Woman dies in glider crash, pilot airlifted to Royal Hobart Hospital

image.altText: Nas and Lily

props.synopsis: Other people with lived experience of blindness gave ABC reporter Nas Campanella the confidence to navigate life. Her mentee, Lily, is enjoying similar benefits.

title.children: Lily didn't want to be blind. Then she met others like herself

image.altText: People walk by a lake in Central Park. The ground is covered in a thick layer of snow.

props.synopsis: At least 1,500 flights were cancelled across the country as some areas received up to 25 centimetres of snow.

title.children: US holiday travel disrupted as snow blankets New York City

image.altText: Plume of smoke and a flash of light as a missile is launches from a US military vessel.

props.synopsis: With US President Donald Trump hinting at plans for further strikes on IS militants in Nigeria, here's a rundown on what you need to know about the conflict.

title.children: Why Trump could order more air strikes in Nigeria

image.altText: Police crime scene on suburban street

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a Quakers Hill home just before 5am after reports of a disturbance to discover a woman dead and a man fatally wounded.

title.children: Sydney stabbing victims 'in a relationship', with 47yo man arrested

image.altText: Children doing homework monitored by AI.

props.synopsis: AI is becoming a regular presence at homework time in many Chinese households. Experts say where families draw the line matters more than the technology itself.

title.children: AI is changing after-school parenting for many Chinese families

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman kissing a dingo puppy.

props.synopsis: When Sonya sees a black-and-tan dingo, she feels a connection to family and Country, but many landholders see them as livestock-killing pests. Can graziers and dingoes co-exist?

title.children: Every time Sonya saves a dingo pup, she breaks the law

image.altText: A seal with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: A wild seal dubbed "Grumpy" causes some commotion at an annual boat race on the Mornington Peninsula, outside Melbourne.

title.children: 'Grumpy' seal disrupts summer boat race at popular holiday spot

image.altText: A man stands on the railings of a jetty as a boy jumps off the railings into the water on his left during summer.

props.synopsis: Rockingham in Perth's south is fast becoming a crucial part of the AUKUS nuclear submarine deal, with promises of a big boost in jobs and infrastructure — but it's also leaving residents afraid for their lives and lifestyle.

title.children: Rockingham grapples with new-found growth as AUKUS plans accelerate

image.altText: Former Daylesford mayor Don Henderson stands in the town's main street, in front of the Rex Theatre building.

props.synopsis: The integrity agency tasked with keeping the local government sector in check is under fire after an ABC investigation raised questions over whether it was properly empowered to carry out its core functions.

title.children: Council watchdog under fire over abrupt end to long investigation

image.altText: People wearing life jackets in a boat looking at pieces of debris floating in water.

props.synopsis: The Labuan Bajo port authority attributes the sinking to high waves of up to three metres, but rescuers say they are "determined" to find survivors.

title.children: Spanish soccer coach missing after tourist boat sinks in Komodo National Park

image.altText: A flood camera picture of a flooded causeway

props.synopsis: The weather bureau says a monsoon trough lingering over north Queensland has the potential to become a lengthy flood event.

title.children: Northern Queensland on flood alert as heavy rain forecast

image.altText: A man hugs a young boy in front of his truck

props.synopsis: At 83, truck driver Terry Bairstow says he would not change a thing after spending six decades behind the wheel carting grain and sheep.

title.children: A career for all ages: Meet the truckies keeping Australia on the road

image.altText: A child with blonde hair and blue eyes wearing a pink long sleeved top, standing in a living room in front of a red couch.

props.synopsis: A woman is calling for tougher pool fencing regulations after her daughter crawled through a faulty fence and drowned in a neighbour’s pool.

title.children: Mum of four-year-old who drowned pleads for safer pool fences

image.altText: A young Brisbane Heat player smiles as his coach puts clasps his hand in celebration.

props.synopsis: Injury to Shaheen Afridi leaves debutant Tom Balkin to bowl the final over, and the 21-year-old delivers to help Brisbane Heat to a seven-run BBL win over Adelaide Strikers.

title.children: Heat call on lightning-fast debutant in rollicking BBL win

image.altText: Matthew Hauser holds up the finish line after coming first in the 2025 World Triathlon Championship Series title in Wollongong.

props.synopsis: Matthew Hauser has always dreamed of becoming a triathlete. After achieving incredible feats this year, the world champion is now eyeing a spot on the Australian Olympic squad.

title.children: Queensland triathlete making history and inspiring a new generation

image.altText: A boy in a white shirt holding a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Sydney teenager Ilia Kyrychenko was relieved to delete his accounts after the social media ban, but the change is making it more difficult to connect with his loved ones in Ukraine.

title.children: How teens stay connected to friends, family overseas without social media

image.altText: A human hand holding 10 white-stemmed mushrooms with golden caps of varying size against grass backdrop.

props.synopsis: Wood-lover paralysis is a poorly understood syndrome related to consuming a native species of magic mushroom, with sufferers experiencing weakness and difficulty breathing in some instances.

title.children: Magic mushroom use rises despite concerns of rare paralysis syndrome

image.altText: A person with a hood on uses a mobile phone as the sit at an advanced computer set up.

props.synopsis: More than 500 data breaches were reported in Australia over the first half of 2025 alone, but there are some ways you can minimise your risk of being caught up in one.

title.children: Cyber attacks that occurred this year and how you can protect your data

image.altText: A wind turbine silhouetted against a clear sky.

props.synopsis: As the green energy boom gathers pace, experts say climate change is a bigger threat to biodiversity than wind farms and other renewables projects.

title.children: Climate a bigger threat to biodiversity than renewables, experts say

image.altText: Man pouring champagne into glasses

props.synopsis: Health-conscious Australians may be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

title.children: Australians are drinking less alcohol — except for one age group
